newsitem.title: USA: Computervision to sell unit to J.F. Lehman.
newsitem.headline: Computervision to sell unit to J.F. Lehman.

text.p: Computervision said it signed an agreement for the sale of its Open Service Solutions business to an investment group headed by J. F. Lehman & Co for $125 million.

On closing the transaction, the business will be conducted under the name of CV Services International Inc. The sale is for $100 million in cash, $25 million in preferred stock in CV Services International Inc., and warrants to buy common shares representing 19 percent of CV Services International Inc.
The company said the transaction furthers its strategic transformation to a software solutions company focused on the fast-growing Electronic Product Definition marketplace.
